title: make nullable test pass
description: The `nullable.test.fidl` golden test currently fails when uncommented in `generate-goldens.sh`. Implement correct parsing and compilation support for nullable modifiers (e.g. `MyStruct? ` or `vector<T>:?`) inside fidlcrs.

title: Validate --name flag
description: The command-line interface now accepts a `--name LIBRARY_NAME` argument. Add validation in fidlcrs to check if the main compiled library actually matches `expected_library_name`. Ensure errors properly reflect mismatches, identical to the C++ fidlc compiler.

title: Port steps architecture from C++
description:
The C++ fidlc implementation in fidlc/src/ implements the compiler in terms of several "steps". The Compiler::Compile() method in fidlc/src/compiler.cc calls each of the steps in a particular order.

Update this Rust implementation, fidlcrs, to follow this same pattern. This may mean moving code that's currently directly on the Compiler struct into separate step structs. Features that are not yet supported fidlcrs don't need to be ported over, but put the structure in place so that they can be added later. In fact, if you notice them add thicket tickets to track that work with details you come across.

As you develop, keep running "cargo check" and "./generate_goldens.sh" to ensure that we move the structure of the program forward without losing ground on features. Don't enable any additional files in the generate_goldens.sh script - if you need broader tests then file a ticket and we'll come back to it later.

title: Fix compiler warnings in main.rs and cli.rs
description: The fidlcrs build currently outputs many warnings about unused variables and mutable variables not mutating. Clean these up to keep the console output clean.

title: More sophisticated goldens generation
description:
Look at how golden files are specified in fidlc/testdata/BUILD.gn and note how different test libraries are defined with different parameters.

In particular look at how the following variables vary based on which filenames are being generated:
 - public_deps
 - experimental_flags
 - versioned
 - contains drivers

Update generate-goldens.sh so that the same variables are set when we go to compile FIDL libraries. Don't worry about using these values yet.

title: Command-line interface
description: fidlcrs must implement the same command-line interface as fidlc. Look at the implementation in fidlc/cmd/fidlc/main.cc and implement the same interface in fidlcrs

title: Port NamingContext logic from C++
description: Port the naming context logic from the C++ fidlc implementation. In particular there's logic in fidlc/src/name.cc fidlc/src/name.h and fidlc/src/consume_step.cc.

title: Pass BUILD.gn variables to fidlcrs in generate-goldens.sh
description: Now that we extract variables like public_deps and experimental_flags in generate-goldens.sh, update the invocation to actually pass these flags to the fidlcrs executable. E.g. --experimental=allow_new_types, etc.

title: Support compiling multiple library dependencies via multiple --files flags
description: The CLI accepts multiple `--files` flags chunks representing dependency libraries in topological order. Currently fidlcrs flattens all files and merges them into the main library AST. It must instead maintain separate library structures, resolve external cross-referencing types across them, and output only the final main library AST while including dependency external types in `library_dependencies` and `external_struct_declarations`.

title: Fix compiler warnings in main.rs and cli.rs
description: Address the remaining unused variables/mutability warnings in main.rs and cli.rs. E.g. _expected_platform, _warnings_as_errors, unused `arg` in main parser loop, etc.

title: Actual parsing for available and versioned
description: The parser currently uses a fake parsing approach for --available and --versioned flags by just calling args.claim() and ignoring the value. Implement true parsing for these parameters per fidlc CLI specs.

title: Support compiling multiple files per invocation
description: The command-line parser in src/main.rs now parses multiple files arguments from the `--files` flag, but the compiler itself only processes the first file. Extend fidlcrs to process all provided files and merge their ASTs correctly into the library compilation.

title: make anonymous test pass
description: The `anonymous.test.fidl` golden test currently fails when uncommented in `generate-goldens.sh`. Implement support for anonymous inline layouts (structs, unions, etc) inside fidlcrs.
